{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3390227,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-22T00:45:56.841Z","cooked":"

So I need a bit of a refresher with motion profiles, feedforward, and feedback controls so I’ve sketched out my thought process for simple control loops. All of this stemmed from looking at the examples and reading the documentation. I want to make sure my headspace is correct. Also I have a question or 2.

Velocity Only Control (flywheels, shooters, intakes, drive wheels, etc)

  1. No need for motion profile?
  2. Calculate feedforward contribution to voltage.
  3. Calculate feedback (PID) contribution to voltage. (Should be negligible)
  4. Sum the two voltage contributions
  5. Apply voltage
  6. Rinse and repeat

Position Only Control (elevators, arms, turrets, wrists, etc)

  1. Trapezoid motion profile the setpoint based on constraints.
  2. Calculate feedforward contribution to voltage with appropriate controller.
  3. Calculate feedback (PID) contribution to voltage.
  4. Sum the two voltage contributions.
  5. Apply
  6. Rinse and repeat.

Position and Velocity Control (wanting/needing the option to manually move things during testing/tuning)

Here is a question. Would it be appropriate to have two separate control loops and just switch back and forth when desired?

I’m assuming if this is a possibility that I would reset the feedback controller the first go in the loop after switching from the other loop?

Also apologies if I’ve asked this one before. I’m assuming the new ExponentialProfile can be a drop in replacement for the TrapezoidProfile, but I’m not 100% certain of that?

The exponential profile requires additional terms, but yes it takes the place of the trapezoid.

We use tuner to move the mechanisms to tune them.

At first glance, your information seems correct.

Tuning was probably not the best word. Basically I would like a system to be controlled in two ways. Not at the same time of course, but with the ability to switch off when needed. Like if we needed manual control of say an elevator during a match to handle things we haven’t preprogrammed setpoint wise for position.

How does the rest of my thought process work?
